title: "Talon and Zed are struggling...let's buff Lethality!"
body:
Oh gee, not like {{champion:21}} {{champion:110}} {{champion:133}} {{champion:126}} {{champion:202}}  would abuse the ever-living shit out of it, right?
Not like some classes can't have nice things because of abuse cases (_cough_{{item:3053}} _cough_)

replies.body: Way too often, Marksman are the reason we can't have nice things.
I guess Ezreal has friends now we can blame instead of just him every time.
Amusingly, Ezreal doesnt even abuse Lethality as much as others. He still wants his Sheen + Tear items first, and then (I think, I don't play Ezreal) you grab your Lifesteal and LW and whatnot.

IKR.  I was indeed referring to the past where he broke almost every item Riot came out with.

It must be integrated into their check-list by now to check every new item by building it on Ezreal during at least one playtest and to modify the item accordingly.

Literally all they have to do is remove his on hit Q. No more Ez breaking items. Shit, buff the Q after, idc. But I'm tired of an Ez with no items but a tear and a tank (bruiser, whatevs, still a tank item) item just straight out damaging everything.
that wouldnt fix anything because his q is still such a low cooldown and he gets  attack speed from landing spells and they arent particualrly hard to land with their travel time being so fast.
Do you know how much his damage would decrease if Qs didn't proc on hit items? Lots. And he would lose the stupid perma slow lol.

i know it would decrease alot  IF he only plays safe poke style but if he auto attacks right after he used q he doesnt lose any damage he actually gains damage because now he is useing his autoattacks. And id like to point out out of all champions who still reduce coodlowns through casting spells {{champion:81}}  {{champion:26}}  {{champion:44}}  ezreal is the only one who still decreases his ult cooldown and its the lowest cooldown ult of these  champions
And if he is playing aggressive enough to be auto attacking you after Qing, you can fight him easily. And most likely win.

assumeing you run to him he kites you if you use an engage spell before your spell even reaches ezreals start their essence flux  to get away so even if you do the damage to him the second you do he is out of range again and safe to continue healing up the damage you just managed to do slightly with lifesteal from {{item:1055}} if not another later lifesteal item

wouldnt ezreal be a good counter to the lethality adc meta?

rushing gauntlet gives you a chunk of armor that practically negates their first 2 items and it gives you more kiting and chasing potential since lethality users tend to be skirmishing casters (lucian, jhin, etc)
thing is lethality adc meta doesnt effect other adcs much just every other class of champion that cant poke or dps as effectively from **_RANGE_** (real important word there).

If only there was some way to stop marksman from ruining items meant for melee champs. Like if there was some feature that prevented ranged champ from buying them in the 1st place. Maybe something 2 words like, oh I don't know, "Fuck Off" (to ranged champs).
Yeah, too bad "melee only" isn't an option in this game, eh. TOO. FUCKING. BAD. RIGHT. RIOT!
But no, item diversity for ranged champ is oh so more important than the balance of items for melee champs.

Limiting items buys by the range of the attacker, especially such a powerful item could warp champion design in the future.  Do you think they'd create a ranged ad assassin if, for example, the lethality items were melee only?  I'm all for having diminished effects on ranged item though, like if they reduced the duration of the spell shield or something like that.

they could... like {{item:3748}} {{item:3074}} 

Or they could just revert lethality formule for ranged
I mean when you have an offense class that scales with items it makes sense that they'd be the first to break offense items.

>AD casters are building items that are good on AD casters

Why are we surprised by this?

> [{quoted}](name=Sona Ping,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=XHv9H6E8,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-02-07T23:55:51.292+0000)
>
> Why are we surprised by this?

The point is, if Zed and Talon are struggling, just buff them instead of buffing a certain aspect on them that's also shared by other people.

"AD casters are building items that are good on AD casters"

Yes, which is why if others besides the ones intended for balance changes also receive buffs for no reason, they become too good, and it's trouble.

I agree. If those two were supposed to be buffed, then just buff those two champions.

However, who and were did it say the Lethality change was _only_ for Zed and Talon?
  Riot said they were buffing marksmen because it was needed and that is what they have been doing.  Patch 7.1 buffed {{champion:119}} {{champion:236}} {{champion:429}} 7.2 buffed Lethality which buffs the builds used by AD Caster Marksmen and this trend is continuing with 7.3 buffs to {{champion:18}} and nerfs to champions like {{champion:126}} who can use those builds but don't need buffs but the opposite, tuning them down instead.

  I don't see how Riot wouldn't be seeing this and not intending it.

I'd like to meet the idiot who buffed Draven and then buffed lethality. Level 1-2 his AAs deal 150 damage. 

When you only have 600-650 HP.

That's just Riot balancing. Been that way for... well, I imagine you've actually been playing League a few years so I'm sure you know already that this isn't anything new for Riot. I'm starting to wonder if there hasn't been a study done yet that sets out to assert whether it's better to have a balance _team_ or a one-man operation for that role, because if there isn't then I kind of want to see one made. 

Because it's not just Riot that has these weird patches where balance seems to shift erratically or people get nerfed despite just a few days ago a member of the dev team saying they were perfectly fine - because Blizzard does this as well. That's not even getting into FPS games (of which Blizzard is also guilty of weird balance there, too, with Year of the Roadhog event currently going on effectively) and other fun genres that tend to have either a larger team dedicated to balance changes or just one man for the role.

And no, I'm not trying to say DotA2 can do no wrong in the balance department either (it's had its share of mis-steps), I'm just curious about whether it's better to have a smaller, more centralized unit for balance or a larger team. Because smaller centralized groups/people seem like they work better. Or I could just have a confirmation bias that I want eliminated, who knows.

I feel like it's to keep the game fresh. Things change, champions shift in and out of power, it keeps people talking about the game. Forced, artificial changes for no reason other than for the sake of change. It just sucks because at a certain point you're compromising game health. If a game is so miserable to play... people won't. I've already found myself playing less and that's saying something considering I've played through the days of OP zed and devourer Yi.

It's funny, because the art department is very, very good for the most part (barring a few mis-steps, but even then after the community points it out they generally fix it in quick order - showing that the art team does value community feedback), but the balance team... well, I distinctly remember a Rioter saying, after Sejuani's nerfs during the Cinderhulk period, "Sejuani had her time in the limelight" and that basically boils down anything there is to say about the balance team.
Because doing so would be too easy and too logical. Can't be real, must be a trap.
Guess the Lethality makes your paper mache armor feel like wet paper mache huh?

I'm not even mad, I'm using Pentakill Mordekaiser.
Makes sense seeing that he's not wearing an awful lot of armor in that skin :^)
Just wait till a zed is running at you with Edge of night on.... and your an immobile mage, slow as crap and the only way to stop the extra run speed from the items is a CC spell........

Quinn always built lethality even when it was weak, she plays like an assassin.
Calling her an abuse case seems misinformed to me.
I just included her since she's rocking a 56% win rate ever since the lethality buffs
Thats only on Euw, she has a 53% win rate across all regions. But yeah they buffed the items way too much, lethality could use a bit of a toning down.

I don't think any champion abuses lethality but I do believe RIto are dumb af when it comes to balancing. I also think the assassin playstyle isn't healthy for her with her current kit because it's way too binary and easy to pull off. Drive in with R Q Auto dead and run out with M/S from her passive.

Alright first of all I don't think talon is doing "that" bad, I don't think leathality needs a buff ffs, and talon's jungling prowess is far superior. 
*Guns cocking* Okay let me explain, put the guns away. First clear is alright, you can even solo the first clear if you want to invade and be discreet. Get greenfathers gift, armor runes, ad, armor pen, or more ad. Talon is a momentum based ganker so pretend you're lee sin or vi, just with a more conditional escape, keep close to walls that you can jump over just in case things go south. 

Play him that way and he can do surprisingly well. You still have to be good with talons mechanics, and remember, invading is made easy by his e, but it's better to upgrade q again by lv 3. I also wouldn't reccomend him as a jungler if you don't jungle very often. He's not freelo.
Oh lethality is the main focus, I don't get an excuse to gush about jg talon?
